results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of {1,2,...,n} such that there are exactly k entries between the entries 1 and 2 (n>=2, 0<=k<=n-2).
comment: Sum of row n = n! = A000142(n).
The expected value of k is (n-2)/3 [From _Geoffrey Critzer_, Dec 19 2009]
maple: T:=proc(n,k) if n-2 < k then 0 else (2*n-2*k-2)*factorial(n-2) end if end proc; for n from 2 to 10 do seq(T(n, k),k=0..n-2) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
mathematica: Table[Table[2 (n - r) (n - 2)!, {r, 1, n - 1}], {n, 1, 10}] // Grid [From _Geoffrey Critzer_, Dec 19 2009]
